dcterms:creator: Sara Beery
Dan Morris
Siyu Yang
dcterms:description: The Wild Deserts project is a reintroduction project based in Sturt National Park, near the north-western border of New South Wales, Australia. The project aims to reintroduce regionally extinct small mammals and monitor their activities where native and non-native predators are present. The dataset consisted of 15000 images with 15 classes of wildlife collected from 30 different cameras around the study site.
dcterms:title: Wild Deserts dataset
